InternshipJob Description
Refinitiv Labs provides a unique opportunity to work in a global team tasked with validating new business opportunities in Financial Services that leverage our data and emerging technologies.

Role Summary:
Refinitiv Labs is looking for an exceptional person to develop and extend our market landscaping and engagement with our primary external stakeholders – and work across the Applied Innovation team to ensure we develop digitally informed ways of identifying new opportunities, operating and executing measurable best practices.

While the Labs team executes on the actual innovation projects, you will be at the heart of the Enablement team that drives our market landscaping and defines, implements and controls a cohesive operating model to underpin activities across Refinitiv Labs in Singapore, and across diverse subject matter experts within the group, which comprises UX, User Interface (UI), Design Thinking, and full stack Data Science, Dev and Engineering expertise.

Major Responsibilities / Accountabilities:

Carries out complex market landscaping, opportunity sizing, research and analysis on a stand-alone basis as part of their workstream
Takes thought leadership role in problem solving and developing practical recommendations
Takes the results to a logical and relevant end product, with minimum supervision
Creates deliverables, including reports, newsletters, spreadsheets, presentations and other outputs to document and communicate findings
Communicates findings externally and internally
Independently interacts and collaborates with mid and senior-level stakeholders
Leads customer insight discussions
Develops materials and execution plans for key/regular customer engagements
Becomes “expert” on specific emerging tech and business areas
May manage junior staff on workstream

Technical /Professional Skills & Competencies:

Essential Skills & Experience Required:

Strong analytical, quantitive and fact finding skills in order to size new opportunities
Curious and passionate about innovating and identifying new opportunities
Excellent relationship building and communication skills, both written and verbal
Self-starter

Desired Skills:

Broad business acumen for customer and partner engagements
Meeting deadlines and multi-tasking
Structured approach to work to enable complex planning

Education/ Certifications:

Bachelor degree
MBA an advantage, but not essential
The Financial and Risk Business of Thomson Reuters is now Refinitiv. Refinitiv equips the financial community with access to an open platform that uncovers opportunity and catalyzes change. With a dynamic combination of data, insights, technology, and news from Reuters, our customers can access solutions for every challenge, including a breadth of applications, tools, and content—all supported by human expertise. At Refinitiv, we facilitate the connections that propel people and organizations to find new possibilities to move forward.

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. Therefore we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Refinitiv is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.
Intrigued by a challenge as large and fascinating as the world itself? Come join us.
Locations
Singapore-Singapore

joblist.job_title: Regional Talent Acquisition Intern - Sephora South East Asia
joblist.summary:
InternshipContext
Sephora, a division of LVMH – Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton global luxury leader, is a global leader in beauty retailing. It successfully operates more than three thousand points of sale across Americas, Europe, Middle East and Asia. Its aim is to animate the most loved beauty community in the world.
Sephora South East Asia is a high growth division of leading global beauty retailer, Sephora. Our teams run omni-channel retail businesses in Singapore, Thailand, Australia and Malaysia, franchise operations in India & Indonesia and we run ecommerce only businesses (the first in the world globally for Sephora!) in Philippines, Hong Kong and New Zealand. Our success is built on innovation, a unique product portfolio, market leading digital capability, and our exceptional people! With ambitious growth plans, we are always looking for talented people who are passionate about building businesses and developing themselves and our customers’ experience.
Regional Talent Acquisition Intern, Sephora South East Asia
This is an exciting opportunity for an individual who is looking or exploring HR functions, especially in the field of Talent Acquisition. The Regional Talent Acquisition Intern will be part of the Talent Acquisition team, which focuses on delivering solutions and assistance related to hiring efficiency & employer branding. You can expect to gain practical skills under the mentorship of committed and experienced leaders, and the invaluable experience of working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
Job Responsibilities
The Regional Talent Acquisition Intern will get to work alongside with the Regional HR team as well as interact with internal stakeholders and employees across all levels and departments. You will be responsible to support day-to-day HR related duties as well as projects in relations to Talent Acquisition.
1. Drive end-to-end Talent Acquisition activities
Craft job descriptions, post jobs on job portals, phone screen candidates, arrange and conduct interviews, execute reference checks and draft offer letters
Review and optimize talent acquisition processes across different country HR teams – Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Australia and Indonesia
Building and maintaining seamless interview processes to ensure great candidate and hiring manager experience
Working closely with hiring managers to prioritise hiring needs
2. Open positions reporting and build a strong pipeline of talents
Consolidate open positon reports from Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Australia and Indonesia
Maintaining data reports and performance metrics to drive improvements
3. Employer branding initiatives
Create content, messages and collateral for social media channels (e.g. LinkedIn) to enhance recruitment and employer brand image
Ensure content are effectively deployed across social media channels in a timely manner
Research interview tools and metrics to increase hiring efficiency
Support other functions in crafting employee communication content
Requirements
The Regional Talent Acquisition Intern will demonstrate strong problem solving and critical thinking skills. He/She should have excellent organization and efficient time management skills to thrive in a deadline-driven environment.
Undergraduates or graduates specializing in Human Resource, Business, Marketing or related fields
A passion for delivering exceptional candidate experience
High initiative, self-driven and a good team player
Flexible to quickly adjust and respond to changing requirements
Process oriented, detailed and meticulous
Excellent English skills - verbal and written proficiency
Strong knowledge of MS Office, including Word, Excel and Power Point

Job description
Edenspiekermann Singapore is looking for an Interaction Designer who can help us translate user-goals and brand identity into outstanding digital experiences. Someone who is able to work on complex projects (https://www.edenspiekermann.com/projects/arthit/) willing to dive deep into a world (https://www.edenspiekermann.com/magazine/the-fastest-way-from-q-to-a/) you didn't even know existed. You're also someone that easily switches to smaller projects, working on UI design and front-end coding. We're hoping to find someone who can do both!

You happened to be one of the best of your class when you graduated. This shows in your portfolio, which consists of interaction design cases for digital products and online services. We're hoping to see some experimental or unexpected work as well. That way we can get acquainted with your creative and original mind!

What we offer
An active and involved role in our small but growing digital design team
A mentor to challenge and guide you so we can all benefit from your skills
A loft-like work location in the lively Joo Chiat heritage neighbourhood of Singapore
A salary in line with market conditions
Max. 8 hour working days
What we hope to find in you
You're a nice person to be around, communicative and open-minded
You love to conceptualise and craft digital products that support user behaviour and work across all devices
Sketch has no secrets for you; you also love to get your hands dirty with recent UI and coding tools like Figma or Framer
You understand and have worked with media queries for responsive websites
You have a keen interest in building awesome experiences with transitions and animations in HTML and CSS. Knowledge of JavaScript is a bonus.
You know how to build modular, scalable components that can be used anywhere on a larger website
You must know Github and the Git workflow (who doesn't, anyway).

Most importantly, you have a passion for learning new things and building cool shit. If most of these statements make sense to you, we'd love to get in touch with you. You need to be fluent in English, and you must be available and able to work in Singapore.
Interested?
We look forward to your application!

Us

The ENTERTAINER is a leading digital company whose main goal is to add value to consumers by bringing them the best incentive offers globally. We are a data-driven, 100% digital, tech company. Providing first-rate offers across renowned dining, leisure, entertainment and hotel brands worldwide, the ENTERTAINER has grown with the aim of creating unbeatable value and loyalty everywhere we go.
We believe that “experience is everything”, resulting in our passion for creating unforgettable experiences for both our customers, partners and employees.
The Team
In just less than a decade, The Asia Team was built from the ground up to what it is now: a solid group of highly-skilled and driven individuals responsible for making Asia one of the largest ENTERTAINER regions across the world. From Sales, to Marketing, to Content, to HR, our team’s goal is to deliver the best product year after year and provide valuable experiences that bring smiles to our members. You’ll currently find us in Singapore, Malaysia, Hong Kong, and Bali but our eyes are also set on expanding to neighbouring locations. So don’t be surprised if you’ll see us in your city soon. Because we are already looking forward to see you.
The Graphic Designer will…
Be responsible for creating designs for banners, e-mailers, Social media campaigns,
sites, print, OOH, (APP UI and UX experience a plus)
Need to be able to share local insight and work with the Global team on local trends.
Brainstorm with teams in other countries and be able to work independently

You’ll enjoy and succeed in this job if….
Strong creative vision and visual arts skills with an established portfolio
of print and digital marketing collateral
UI experience
Flexibility to work last minute overtime as needed
If you are an amazing designer!

Experience required
Agency experience a must
Have experience designing, banners, e-mailers, site, print, OOH, ( UX and UI a plus)
An established portfolio
Ability to partner with different teams and departments within the organization
Adobe Photoshop, InDesign, Sketch, all CSS3 Skills
Excellent verbal/ written communication skills
GIF Animation Skills
Salesforce knowledge advantageous but not required

You will be adopting project management methodologies in order to successfully achieve client's objectives which includes time, cost and quality parameters. You will take a lead position in interacting with the client and other consultants at all project stages.

Recognised Degree in Engineering (Civil, Mechanical or Electrical).
A minimum of 20 years working experience in Japan with a successful track record of delivering projects in data centres or hi tech sectors.
Leadership position for the past 5 years.
Strong ability to manage clients, contractors and other vendors; a mix of consultancy and contractor experience will be highly advantageous.
Candidates with the ability to work independently in a diverse working environment will be highly sought after.
Role is based full time in Tokyo, Japan.
Candidates have to be effectively bilingual in both English and Japanese as the role requires communicating and managing stakeholders in both languages.
